name: #dyslexia 2
description:
#dyslexia 2
Original made 2018/2019 , paper/brush/acrylic/airbrush , 35,8*23,4 cm.

The work is part of the #dyslexia series. This is one of the first works in the genre of pure abstraction.
I used a brush and acrylic and airbrush to create it. The composition is constructed as a conflict of geometric shapes and spots of paint in which only the act of the viewer's perception of the final composition is of decisive importance.

The language of abstraction is self-explanatory. Abstraction speaks body language. You just feel it like an overhanging cloud, wind, or the presence of a large object.
